rvc.ace

Class TCPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • rvc.ace.TCPClient

  • class TCPClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The TCPClient class implements a client that receives tasks from a server. It compiles and runs the tasks and send the results back to the server that sent them.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

    • Method Detail

      • restartStreams

        private void restartStreams()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        restartStreams method - restarts the streams for the client-server communication.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • startListening

        public void startListening()
        startListening method - communicates with the server. When the client is not busy, it requests makes requests while there are still tasks available on the server. Requests are made by calling the getTasksList method that receives the list of tasks available, chooses a task, runs the code and returns the result. When there are no more tasks available, the method returns and it means that all the tasks were processed and the results were sent to the server.

      • getTasksList

        private void getTasksList()
        getTasksList method - collects the list of available tasks from server. It also sorts the tasks and chooses the appropriate task to be requested from the server by calling the getFile method. The client is now set to ‚busy’ until the task is done.

      • getFile

        private void getFile()
        getFile method - requests from server the chosen task to be resolved. Then, it receives the info about the task and the file to run. After it finishes receiving, it calls the executeFile method where the code is executed and the result is received.

      • executeFile

        private void executeFile(java.lang.String filename,
                         java.lang.String extension,
                         java.lang.String arguments)
        executeFile method - compiles and runs the file corresponding to the current task. After it receives the result, it calls the sendResult method which sends the result to the server. It also deletes the file received for the current task, since the result was received and the file is no longer needed.
        Parameters:
        filename - a string containing the file name corresponding to the current task
        extension - a string containing the extension of the file
        arguments - a string containing the arguments

      • sendResult

        private void sendResult(java.lang.String result)
        sendResult method - receives the result of the current task and sends it to the server from which it was requested.
        Parameters:
        result - a string containing the result to be sent to the server

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
